channel.title: BUbuisnessAndMarket
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from BUbuisnessAndMarket, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: SpaceX launches rescue mission for astronauts stuck on ISS due to Boeing capsule’s glitches
item.description: The capsule rocketed into orbit to fetch the test pilots whose Boeing spacecraft returned to Earth empty earlier this month because of safety concerns...

item.title: California’s governor vetoes bill requiring new cars to beep at speeding drivers
item.description: California would have become the first to require such systems for all new cars, trucks and buses sold in the state starting in 2030.

item.title: Tesla could have a tough time living up to the hype around its robotaxi event
item.description: Even as Tesla's shares rip higher in September, Wall Street remains divided on the stock amid doubt around its long-term potential as a leading automa...

item.title: Talks between Boeing and machinists break off with strike in its 3rd week
item.description: The strike is in its third week, and negotiations also stalled earlier in the walkout, halting production of Boeing's best-selling airplanes.

item.title: ‘Sell in May’ was a costly mistake. But should you buy now?
Mark Cuban warns the U.S. must win the AI race ‘or we lose everything’
item.description: "Our military dominance, our place in the world depends on our ability to invest in AI. Period. End of story."

item.title: Bull market enters fourth quarter with just about everything going its way
item.description: Mike Santoli breaks down the current state of the bull market and whether it's time for a breather.

item.title: Volkswagen cuts forecasts again as demand wanes while EV competition ramps up
item.description: The automaker trimmed its operating margin, global deliveries, and automotive cash flow guidance.

item.title: Nvidia’s stock chart shows how bulls are using the recent pause to refresh
Port strike could come at a ‘high political cost’ for Harris campaign
Paul Bilzerian avoided a $180 million fine for years. The SEC finally caught up.
Dow clinches record close as U.S. stocks book weekly gains
SpaceX launches rescue mission for 2 NASA astronauts who are stuck in space until next year
item.description: Boeing has struggled with a variety of issues over the years, repeating a Starliner test flight with no one on board after the first one veered off co...

item.title: Netanyahu says Israeli killing of Hezbollah leader Hassan Nasrallah 'will not be enough'
item.description: Nasrallah has led the Lebanon-based group since 1992, taking the reins after Israel assassinated the group's previous leader, Abbas al-Musawi.

item.title: Utilities are the hottest part of the stock market right now, on track for their best year since 2000
item.description: Power and light and related stocks are also on course for their strongest year since 2000.
